block.p: Sarah Montague Mason, the daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Appleton Adams Mason III of Albany, was married there yesterday to Terrence Michael Burgess, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Bruce Burgess of Beverly, Mass. The Rev. Charles W. Sheerin performed the ceremony at St. Peter's Episcopal Church. The Rev. David V. Berberian, a Roman Catholic priest, took part in the service.

Mrs. Mason, 28, is a pediatric social worker at the New England Medical Center in Boston. She graduated from the University of Colorado at Boulder and received a master's degree in social work in May from Simmons College. Her father is an associate professor of family medicine at Albany Medical College. Her mother, Caroline Mason, is the headmistress at the Albany Academy for Girls.

Mr. Mason, 29, is an associate analyst with MFS Investment Management, in Boston. He graduated from Bates College and received a M.B.A. degree from Boston College. His mother, Nancy Mason, is a pediatric nurse with Garden City Pediatrics in Beverly. His father is a lawyer and a vice president at Jon Jay Associates, a law practice in Peabody, Mass.

WEDDINGS Correction: September 24, 2000, Sunday A report last Sunday about the wedding of Sarah Montague Mason and Terrence Michael Burgess misstated the couple's married name. They are Mr. and Mrs. Burgess, not Mason. The report also misstated the surname of the bridegroom's mother at one point. As noted elsewhere, she is Nancy Burgess, not Mason.
